circumstances: William Hall, often living off-grid, was last seen traveling along the highway near Coxton Park, Elgin, IV30 8AZ. Known for his sporadic ventures and minimalist lifestyle, William often sought isolation away from digital connectivity. On the day he vanished, he left behind minimal clues except for a brief interaction with his aunt, Jennifer Hall, who was initially unconcerned due to his usual habits. Later, concern grew when he missed a planned meeting at 25 Harbour Road, Inverness, IV1 1SY. Collateral reports indicated that William might have entered an elevator at Longman Drive, Inverness, IV1 1SU, which was known for being a service access to the rooftops. His reappearance days later revealed he had been camping in a secluded part of Glenurquhart.

circumstances: William Hall was last seen leaving his office where he worked late that evening. He took the elevator down to the ground floor and planned to meet his colleague at their regular bar for a brief catch-up. Despite confirming plans via text, William never arrived. His son, Leon Jones, was the first to notice his absence and reported him missing when he failed to return home. Leon attempted to reach him multiple times with no success. Further inquiries revealed that William was also expected at a dentist office appointment later the same day, which he missed. The police traced William to an address at 48 Orchard Park, Beauly, IV4 7DX, unharmed but disoriented. There were no indications of foul play, and his sudden departure remained unexplained.
q_17_explanation: William's disappearance was unusual as he missed planned appointments and did not arrive.
q_20_explanation: William intended to meet a colleague but failed to complete this intention.

circumstances: William Hall, known to have withdrawn from his family, left his home on Hamilton Drive, IV30 4NN during a severe storm. His aunt, Janice Hall, mentioned that his recent behavior was concerning but not alarming. William did not inform any family members of his whereabouts, fueling concern when he didn't return home. Initial investigations revealed no immediate danger, and his case was labeled low risk. Search efforts focused on possible routes he could have taken, including areas around Black Isle Road, Muir of Ord. After seven days, William was located safely by police at an address in Elgin, ending the brief disappearance without incident.
